content: into each available space you need to make sure that you place a multiple of 24 +1 single_crochet for the lace repeat to work 24 is a large multiple so i have added a guide on how many single_crochet you should add for different bust sizes 28-32 inch bust = 73 single_crochet 33-37 bust = 97 single_crochet 38-44 bust = 121 single_crochet 45 -50 bust = 145 single_crochet 51-55 bust = 169 single_crochet 56 -60 bust = 193 single_crochet please note this is just a guide of the single_crochet amount you should aim for or you can create the gauge swatch page 4 for the 1 repeat 24 +1 stitches and work out how many single_crochet you would need from that measurement you may notice that you need to add a couple extra single_crochet or even create a couple of single_crochet decreases to reach this amount adding extra single_crochet = placing 2 single_crochet into 1 stitch instead of 1 removing single_crochet single_crochet decrease = insert hook into the 1st stitch yo pull up a loop insert hook into the 2nd stitch yo pull up a loop 3 loops on hook yo and pull through all loops this making 2 stitches into 1 for the sample size i created 73 single_crochet across and i placed a couple of single_crochet decreases to reach this amount step 8 1st row of repeat wrong side facing up chain 4 1st double_crochet + chain 1 and turn your work place a puff into the 1st stitch *skip 1 1 single_crochet chain 5 skip 3 1 single_crochet chain 5 skip 3 1 single_crochet skip 1 and into the next stitch place 1 puff chain 3 1 puff stitch* repeat ** across the row at the end of the row place 1 puff chain 1 and 1 double_crochet into the last stitch step 9 2nd row of repeat right side facing up chain 1 never counts as stitch and turn your work 1 single_crochet into the 1st stitch chain 5 1 single_crochet into the chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space *chain 1 6 double_crochet into the chain 3 space chain 1 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the chain 3 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space* repeat ** across the row at the end chain 5 and place 1 single_crochet into the last stitch 3rd chain up on the chain 4 step 10 3rd row of repeat wrong side facing up chain 4 1st double_crochet + chain 1 and turn your work 1 puff into the 1st stitch 1 single_crochet into the chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5 space *chain 2 1 double_crochet chain 2 x6 1 single_crochet into the chain 5 space chain 5 1 single_crochet into the next chain 5
